project.description:
WS-Security username token service. Tested in Wildfly 8.2.0.Final.
1) Starting code-first, save the generated WSDL in WEB-INF and add the WSIT extensions as needed. Provide the location in 'wsdlLocation' attribute of the @webService annotstion on the endpoint. Starting contract-first, put the WSDL in WEB-INF.
2) In this project, a password callback is configured. The password is retrieved for the username in the request context. In this case, the password is simply hard-coded but it may also be retrieved from a keystore.
3) Deploy the service by running 'mvn clean package wildfly:run -P wildfly'.
4) Hit http://localhost:8080/calculator-username-token-service/CalculatorUTService?wsdl from a browser and verify that the policy is included in the generated WSDL.
5) The following entry needs to be added to the MANIFEST.MF. The maven war plugin does that for a regular build. Dependencies: org.apache.ws.security
References: https://docs.jboss.org/author/display/WFLY8/WS-Security http://cxf.apache.org/docs/ws-securitypolicy.html
